Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent of the destruction by stating that the Palestine National Library, the Azhar Library, and the "National Cultural Center" were destroyed by the Israel military, when in fact only the Said al-Mishal Centre was destroyed.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Palestine National Library and the Azhar Library were not destroyed by the Israel military.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to verify the destruction of the mentioned libraries.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the destruction of the Said al-Mishal Centre was intentional and targeted at Palestinian cultural heritage, without providing substantial evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the destruction of the Said al-Mishal Centre, such as the Israeli military's assertion that it was being used for military purposes by Hamas.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting inaccurate or misleading information and using outdated images to support the claim.
